speech: Sheppard's team is on the run and under fire.
(panicked) This is pretty much my top gear!
Sheppard and Ronon pause at cover and return fire while Teyla and McKay get to the DHD.
If we make a stand here, we can take 'em!
Negative. We don't know how many we're up against! (he shoots again and turns to the others) Rodney, dial the damn gate! Don't wait for us!
McKay is already dialing while Teyla provides cover fire.
(frantic) As if the bullets whizzing past my head weren't encouragement enough!
(into radio) This is McKay to Atlantis! We're coming in hot!

McKay and Teyla run through the Stargate. Ronon and Sheppard follow. Someone fires a twin harpoon at Sheppard, piercing his vest and pulling him backward to the ground at the last second. Ronon makes it through and the wormhole shuts down.

Sheppard finds himself surrounded by several armed Genii. The harpoon shooter is Kolya, who lowers his weapon and approaches. He smiles and crouches closer to the ground to be more on Sheppard's level.
It's good to see you again, Colonel.
Several heavily armed teams walk through the Stargate from an incoming wormhole. Weir stands waiting for them. Teyla, McKay, and Ronon are the last to arrive.
There was no sign of Colonel Sheppard or our attackers.
And they covered their tracks well.
There's a good chance he was transported off-world, so I've gathered the last fifty or so gate addresses that were dialed.
That should be helpful, but since the transmission which summoned us to the planet was sent using a code we gave to the Genii, that will be our starting point.
(sarcastically) What are you gonna do, like ask the Genii if one of them took Sheppard?
Ronon and McKay move out of the path of the kawhoosh as the Stargate activates.
Incoming wormhole! We're receiving the new identification code.
Ladon and three Genii soldiers enter from the wormhole.
I came as soon as I--
Ronon approaches Ladon and towers over him.
(firmly) Ronon, he is here as our guest.
Ronon has a snarl on his face, but steps back.
Sheppard is in a cell. It has three stone walls and the front is encased with metal bars. Another cell is next to his.
Kolya? I didn't kill you last time, remember?
Gah! (sotto voce) You promised me points for that. (yelling) Kolya! (to himself) Dammit. Should've killed him.
(from the next cell) You're wasting your breath.
Didn't know I had company down here.
Sheppard steps to the wall between the cells. There is a small barred window between the cells.
Prisons are like that. Never stopped me before. How long have you been down here?
Sheppard peers through the bars, trying to get a look at his neighbor. All he can see is a shadowed figure shifting his legs.
Oh, that many, huh? What did you do to get here?
I merely allowed myself to be captured alive.
Same here. Look, I got people looking for me, and when they find me, maybe we can both uh--
An outer door to the area opens, and three armed Genii soldiers arrive and unlock Sheppard's cell.
The guard cocks a large alien shotgun type weapon.
The guard fires a blast past Sheppard's soldier, blowing a large hole through the wall behind him. Sheppard flinches from the blast and gets struck by debris.
Oh, he insists? Well, why didn't you just say so?

Sheppard steps out of the cell. After he passes the guard with the shotgun, he spins back and delivers a roundhouse punch, trying to pull the shotgun out of the guard's grasp. Another guard strikes him with a small whip that emits some kind of electric charge. Sheppard shouts in pain and collapses unconscious.
The other guards drag Sheppard away.
Atlantis SFs disarm the Genii guards. They lead away all but Lodan and his aide.
I'm sorry this is necessary, but under the circumstances, I'm sure you understand.
I came here as a friend, Doctor Weir; I hope to leave as one.
And we appreciate your concern for Colonel Sheppard.
Despite the fact that it was your incompetence that led to his capture.
I'm sorry, but there is no disputing the fact that it was a code we provided the Genii that was used to lure us to that planet where we were ambushed!
Doctor McKay is quite correct. You entrusted us with codes, and I allowed them to be stolen from us. How and by whom is an ongoing investigation, but I must assume it was someone close to me.
Or this is part of your plans.
(with humorless smile) It would not be the first time.
I say this rhetorically, since I should think it is obvious. But if I were involved in this in any way, or if my intentions were anything less than honorable, would I have come to Atlantis?
With you, who knows? All I know is my friend has been kidnapped, and you had something to do with it.

Which is why I have walked away from significant responsibilities as leader of my people to come here and offer our help. Now, you can either let me do that, or you can continue to berate me for my mistake. The choice is yours.
Oh, we have more choices than that!
I see no reason to stay here if this is how I am to be treated.
Trust me, you're not goin' anywhere.
Ronon, I understand how you feel. Believe me, I do. But we're gonna deal with this my way. (to Ladon) Let's continue this in my office...privately.
She and Ladon head up the stairs, leaving the others standing there.
Sheppard is tied to chair in the room. The three guards are there, as well as Kolya. A device similar to a 1950s era television studio camera is wheeled nearby.
You must have really missed me to go through all this trouble. Nice harpoon, by the way.
To capture an extraordinary soldier takes extraordinary measures.
I'll take that as a compliment.
As you should. Just as you should understand this is not personal. As soon as my goal is achieved, you'll be returned to Atlantis.
That simple, huh? What do you want?
It's not a question of what I want. It's a question of who.

Now, I entrusted the IDC codes you provided to two men in my government--my second minister in the event of my death, and my personal assistant, Cassel Massan. I trust both of these men implicitly...or rather I did.
Are both men now accounted for?
Yes. In fact, they're in custody. They're being questioned as we speak.
Don't underestimate the importance of this alliance between our two peoples to the Genii, Doctor Weir. In fact, when I heard the news, my first concern was--
(over comm) We have an unscheduled off-world activation.
Weir and Ladon leave the room.
McKay is at a console beside Chuck.
None, but we're receiving an analog video signal.
A fuzzy image of Kolya appears on screen.
(over video) Doctor Weir, if you're receiving this, please respond.
Everyone stares at the image in shock.
Aucustus Kolya. A Genii military leader who once tried to seize Atlantis. Ladon was a member of his strike team.
Ronon turns and glares at Ladon, processing this information.
(over video) I do know you're there, Doctor. The existence of Atlantis is no secret among the Genii. It would be...pointless not to answer.
Chuck signals the line is active.
(over video) Oh good. I wanted to be certain you were there to see this.
Kolya steps to the side to reveal a bound and gagged Sheppard sitting behind him.
What have you done to him?
Okay, let me rephrase that. What are you planning to do?
(over video) Oh, it's quite simple. I'd like to make a trade.
Before we continue this conversation another second, I want to speak with Sheppard.
We'll rephrase that, too. We would like him to be able to speak to us.
He nods and a guard removes Sheppard's gag.
(shouting desperately through video) On my command authority, whatever he asks, don't do it! Even if--
The guard quickly replaces the gag, and Kolya laughs.
(over video) Well, as you can see, he's his usual charming self.
(over video) I have heard the familiar voices of yourself and Doctor McKay. But there is one person I know is there who has yet to speak. Ladon Redim is with you, is he not?

(over video) Well, to preserve his precious alliance with you, Doctor, so that the Genii might remain in the favor of Atlantis. My sources have already confirmed this, so there's no point in denying the fact. Turn him over to me, and Colonel Sheppard will be released immediately.
Ladon looks nervous. Weir exchanges looks with McKay.
(coldly) I'll need time to consider your offer.
(over video) Allow me to help expedite your decision.
The camera pans to the door of the room. Guards lead in a fettered and weakened Wraith.
Sheppard gives increasingly panicked breaths through his gag as the Wraith is led near him.
(desperately, through radio) Sheppard could have left you to rot down in that hole when we last met, Kolya. He does not deserve this!
Let's be clear, Doctor McKay. No one does.
The Wraith is unchained from his manacles and physically held back from Sheppard.
(over radio) Don't do this. Don't do it!
The choice is yours, Doctor Weir. Do we have an arrangement?
Kolya nods to his men. The Wraith stares at Sheppard, then slams his feeding hand onto Sheppard's chest. Sheppard is in agony.

The guard use the electric whip to break the Wraith away from Sheppard and pull him back. Sheppard is weakened and in shock. His sideburns are streaked with grey and there are lines around his eyes. Kolya appears moved by Sheppard's state, but schools his face to be impassive as Sheppard glares at him.
(determined) You've just crossed a line, Kolya.

(over video) We've found that a minimum of three hours between feeding sessions is crucial to ensure the body has sufficient time to recover from the trauma. That's the time you have to decide. Three hours.
Kolya's face has filled the screen, and the image shuts off. Everyone exchanges troubled looks.
Sheppard lies half propped against a wall of his cell. His neighbor can be heard in the next cell.
(weakly) Yeah. That's my name. Pleased to meet you.
Well, I just got fed on by a Wraith. What do you think?
Hopefully, you'll never have to find out.
He shifts to sit up and groans in pain at the effort.
I didn't think anything could hurt that much.
Yeah, well...I don't know how many years the darn thing took off my life. But I'll tell you this: if Kolya's men hadn't'a pulled that damn thing off, I'd be dust in a flak jacket.
Do you blame the Wraith, or the master?

There is a difference. The Wraith must feed in order to live. For a Wraith, hunger burns like a fire. Tell me, Sheppard, if you found yourself burning alive, would you settle for just one drop of water, or would you take more?
Sheppard furrows his eyebrows. While the prisoner speaks, he struggles to his feet to try and look at his neighbor through the window.
(suspiciously) When'd you hear them call me "Sheppard"?
The prisoner steps forward into the light. His fellow prisoner is the Wraith.
Just before I started to feed.
Ladon, Weir, and the remainder of Sheppard's team are in the room. All but Ronon are sitting. Ronon leans against the wall directly behind Ladon's chair.
Of course, you would see him only as the monster who tried to take your city from you.
Kolya also killed several of our people.
He would have killed Doctor Weir as well.

I won't make excuses for his actions or mine during the failed Atlantis mission. We were soldiers under Cowan's orders. But that failure shattered Kolya's stature among the Genii. It forced him from Cowan's inner circle.
Cowan had no choice but to keep me. I was his chief scientist.
And you just left Kolya out in the cold.
That was his choice, not mine. I will admit, in what little contact we had before Kolya went underground, he spoke of overthrowing Cowan's corrupt regime, and I was admittedly torn.
Out of the belief that neither man had what it took to lead the Genii into the future.
So, instead you--having what it took--overthrew Cowan yourself.
Kolya believes that I have taken his rightful place as leader of our people.
Well, obviously he has men loyal to him in your inner circle. Hence the codes.
Well, those traitors will be found.
Sounds like you're the traitor to me.
The more I hear, the more I'm glad he is.

(uncomfortably) I could have told you anything. I chose to tell you the truth. If you trade my life for Sheppard's, you will not only be yielding to blackmail, but you will be planting the seeds of civil war.
So what? I say we turn him over and let 'em fight it out.
Colonel Sheppard has already ordered us not to.
(nodding) At this point, it's not his decision. There's still time for us to find him and launch a rescue operation. Has there been any progress?

We have a list of planets where recent Genii activity's been documented, but we'd have a much higher margin of success if Ladon would be willing to point out firm locations of Genii safe houses and shelters, maybe even hidden Wraith-infested torture chambers.
They all turn to Ladon. Ronon moves closer. Ladon nods nervously.
Sheppard paces in his cell, breathing heavily.
Your anger will only weaken you.
You realize he is torturing both of us?
Oh yeah? What'd he do to you?
Really? And how is that torture?
Have you ever known starvation, Sheppard? The few years I took from you are barely enough to keep me alive. The strength I gained from you is already fading.
I don't really give a damn.
You pace in your cell, cursing that I took years from you...I stand here cursing that I was not allowed them all! Each, in our own way, we suffer!
Sheppard approaches the window and glares at the Wraith.
This might come as a surprise to you, but I'm not really in the mood for conversation. So why don't you just do me a favor, and shut the hell up!
The Wraith reaches out with his feeding hand, but there is enough space between the windows of their shared cells that he can't quite reach. Sheppard flinches slightly in startled fear.
These are your last hours, Sheppard. If you wish to spend them in silence, then so be it.
No. I'm getting outta here. I've got a life to go back to, and I'm damn well going back to it.
Sheppard starts pacing again. The Wraith watches him, intrigued.
Sheppard sits back against the far wall, groaning with the effort.
Yeah. I've got friends. And they're gonna come for me.
I hope you continue to believe that...the next time I feed.

Elizabeth, I'm just saying if you decide in favor of trading for Colonel Sheppard, it'd be best if you did so before the next feeding. I honestly don't know how many sessions a man can take, even someone as strong as Colonel Sheppard.
Is it possible he can recover from this?
We still know so little about the feeding process. All I can tell you is that each time he's fed upon, his chances of survival diminish severely.
Weir nods. McKay and Ladon climb the stairs to the control room.
(yelling from stairs as he approaches) Doctor Weir! We've got a match! We went through database. Between our list and Ladon's, there's only one potential location that makes any sense.
McKay leaves. Weir and Ladon exchange looks.
Several personnel check their rifles. The Stargate is already active. McKay paces behind with his own rifle as Teyla, Ronon, and Beckett watch bemused.
(emphatically) All right, people. Let's do this one by the numbers. We get in, we get our man, we get out. Stay sharp, and stay alive.
(abashed) Oh, just things that Sheppard would say, so I just thought I would--
Everyone starts heading through the Stargate, including Beckett.
McKay looks up at the balcony. Weir is there.
McKay gives a thumbs up sign and follows the others.
Sheppard is again tied to the chair. Kolya and his men are nearby.
I thought you said this wasn't personal.
The truth is, I would've settled for Doctor McKay. But I don't imagine I would enjoy his constant wailing.
They're never gonna make the trade, Kolya. Why don't you just finish this?
I think you underestimate the sympathetic nature of Doctor Weir.
You prefer I storm Atlantis and take Ladon by force?
What've you got? Half a dozen men and a starving Wraith? Yeah, you go right ahead.
One way or the other, Ladon is mine. Protecting him is a waste of my time and your life.
I was the one planning to overthrow Cowan. Ladon disclosed those plans, forcing me underground, then staged a coup of his own. He took what was rightfully mine. (to guards) Bring in the Wraith.

The Atlantis teams are pressed against the building. Ronon throws a smoke grenade through the window to the door, breaking the glass. Waiting a few moments, he primes his gun and slams open the door. The others follow.
Go go. We're on it. Clear it out.

Ronon and Teyla lead the others, who spread through the building with military precision. Ronon stuns a Genii guard running down a corridor. He, Teyla, and some others approach cautiously. The man is unconscious.
McKay is alone checking out another section of the warehouse. He hears a small rattle high above him and instantly starts firing his P-90.
The others hear and instantly run towards him. McKay looks sheepish as guards approach weapons raised.
He gives a thumbs up. Beckett, Teyla, and Ronon arrive.
Uh...I thought I saw something out of the corner of my eye...I just-uh-you know...I reacted.
Um...a mouse. A really big one though. Uh, more of a rat really, possibly rabid.
This isn't the place, is it?
And we've just wasted two and a half hours.
Weir and Ladon stand in the office, Atlantis SFs right outside.
Well, then, the only way for me to help is to return to my homeworld and mobilize the resources of my military.
You can contact them from here.
Do you think I don't know the real reason you're keeping me here?

You are a head of state. It was John Sheppard's last order that we do not submit to Kolya's demands. It is my own country's policy to never yield to terrorists. Those are the reasons you're still here Mister Radim. Because believe me, if it was simply my choice...
(interrupting) Good. Now we don't have much time. I want you to look over our list of planets again. See if there's anything you could--
Looks to be another video feed.
Patch it through and open a channel.
Kolya appears on a video monitor.
(over video) I'm pleased to see you're wasting no time. So neither will I.
He paces, the camera following his movements. Sheppard, now gagged as well appears through the monitor.
Kolya nods to the guard who holds the Wraith by Sheppard. The guard releases the Wraith's feeding arm from its manacle, the leather cover free.
(over video) Will you turn Ladon Radim over to me in exchange for Colonel Sheppard? Doctor Weir?
In the background, Sheppard subtly shakes his head 'no'.
(over video) I can only conclude you doubt my sincerity.

Kolya nods to the Wraith and guard. The Wraith pauses, staring at Sheppard, who looks back. Finally he feeds for several seconds. When finished, Sheppard's hair has turned grey and he has more pronouced wrinkles. He is intense pain, but still glares defiantly at Kolya.
The guards drop Sheppard into his cell; he stays on his hands and knees, and crawls over to lean against the wall closest to the window. The Wraith is already in his own cell.
Yeah, I do. They just need more time.
(shaking his head) No one has ever left this place alive.
Kolya will kill you before your friends have a chance to reach the cells.
(considering) How well you know the layout of this place?
Well enough to know what they would be up against.
Sheppard struggles up the wall to stand and face the Wraith.
What about us? Do you know enough about this place to get us out?
What? Are they gonna let you go after I'm dead?
Well then what've you got to lose?
Oh yeah, you got a great one down here.
Hey, listen! It makes sense. We have a common goal.
(disturbed) As I said before...there is no escape.
Guards come and open the door to Sheppard's cell. One guard gets his electrical crop ready.

Sheppard slowly walks out. He looks towards the Wraith cell. The Wraith is already fettered and being led out by other guards. Sheppard and the Wraith exchange looks. One of the guards, annoyed at the delay, punches Sheppard in the face. The prisoners are led out.
The video link between Kolya and Atlantis is active. Ladon, Weir, Beckett, and Sheppard's team watch.
(over video) He still has years ahead of him, Doctor Weir. My offer stands.
(considering) Then you're effectively ending his life.
(over video) I can't help but wonder what you've told them so they'd choose you over one of their own.
That I betrayed you. That I took for myself what you believed to be rightfully yours.
(over video) The truth. I must say, I'm surprised.
If you release him, you may return to our people with my promise of amnesty.
(over video) Please, Ladon. I've trained you better than that. There are things that cannot be undone.
That's not true! You can end this!
(over video) Strange, Doctor. I was just about to say the same thing.
Behind Kolya, the Wraith can be seen being moved into position.
Everyone watches in horror. Ronon cries out and walks away, unable to watch.
The Wraith suddenly stops feeding and pulls his hand away.
He is near death. Shall I finish him?
Kolya stares at Sheppard, who is even more visibly aged. He looks away.
(to guards) Get it out of here.
The guards drag the Wraith away.
The video feed and the Stargate shuts off.
If he's fed upon again, he's as good as dead.

Aye, Rodney, we do. He may already be past the point of no return. We know that a large percentage of those that survive a partial feeding die anyway...due to complications as a result of strain on the system. What appears as physical aging is actually a byproduct of a complex process we barely understand. I can't imagine him surviving another session--whether it's two hours or ten hours from now.
(to Ladon) If you were half the man Sheppard is, you'd volunteer to make the trade yourself.

Truth is, I'm not sure whether or not I would've made the trade if our roles were reversed. (to Weir) So I ask you, allow what you have done for me to be worth something. There's nothing more I can do here, but I can get you the information you need to find Sheppard if you allow me to return and interrogate the men who stole the codes from me.
Weir exchanges looks with the others.
Sheppard wakes up in his cell. He moves with difficulty. He looks up to see the Wraith observing him from its own cell.
You know, I could've sworn I was gonna wake up dead today.
You are strong. Stronger than any human I have ever fed upon.
Because, the longer I feed, the weaker you become...and we will need what strength you have left...to escape.
Now he wants to escape. Hmm.
The Stargate is active. The Genii guards get back their weapons. Weir and Sheppard's team escort Ladon down the stairs.
I lack the words to thank you, Doctor Weir.
I didn't do this for you.
Well, nevertheless, I'll be in touch the moment I have the information that you need.
You know, I have the sinking feeling we've just made a terrible mistake.

The guards approach to get Sheppard and the Wraith. They pull Sheppard to his feet and drag him out. Other guards pull the Wraith out and begin to attach the restraints. The feeding arm is sheathed. Sheppard pretends to collapse, catching the men offguard, and slamming them both into the bars. The Wraith backhands one of his guards and uses the chain restraining him to choke the other, slamming the feeding arm lock against the wall until it releases. He starts feeding on the guard he chokes.

Sheppard gains the upper hand on his two stunned guards. Meanwhile the other guard with the Wraith pulls his sidearm and shoots several rounds into the Wraith. The feeding Wraith screams in pain. Sheppard notices and grabs the knife on the belt of the guard he's fighting and throws it at the shooter, hitting him in the chest. The Wraith continues to feed on the guard. Sheppard knocks his guard out and rummages at the guy's belt. The Wraith approaches and notices Sheppard now has a sidearm. Sheppard glances at the Wraith, then throws him the keys. The Wraith frees his other hand. Sheppard grabs the other guard's sidearm and warily hands it over to the Wraith.

Sheppard and a Wraith stand sheltered at a corner near guarded areas. The Wraith studies the Genii sidearm, distractedly holding it near Sheppard's face. When Sheppard notices, he knocks the weapon aside so it's not aimed so near him. He holds a Genii radio in his hand with a meaningful expression and activates it.

The Genii guard lifts his radio when he hears squelch coming from the receiver. Sheppard immediately grabs him from behind, knife at ready. The other guard moves to help, but the Wraith grabs him and breaks his neck. Another guard arrives and shoots the Wraith. He starts to shoot at Sheppard, but the guard Sheppard holds acts as a shield. The rounds kill that guard. Sheppard is able to fire his own sidearm and kill the guard. Sheppard glances at the rounds in the Wraith's side questioningly.
He indicates the staircase leading up. Sheppard replaces his empty gun for a new one and follows the limping Wraith.
Later, Kolya and other guards find the bodies.
I want ten armed men at the Stargate. The rest of you, hunt them down.
A round vertical access tunnel is in the forest. The hatch opens, and Sheppard and the Wraith climb out. Both move with difficulty.
(irritated) They will be waiting for us!
The Wraith groans and half-collapses into a sitting position on the edge of the hatch.
The Wraith tries to stand, reaching out with his feeding hand. Sheppard steps back and raises his pistol. The Wraith finally stands and sees Sheppard, thus raising his own gun.
When we make it to the Stargate, we both go our separate ways. Until then, we're gonna need each other. Deal?
The Wraith nods. He then stumbles into the forest, Sheppard following.
Weir stands at the balcony. Chuck the technician approaches.
It's coming up on two hours. We should receive the next transmission any minute now.
Yes, I'll be there in a moment.
Chuck nods and leaves her alone.
The Wraith and Sheppard continue to stumble through the woods.
I was blindfolded all the way to the bunker. It wasn't this far.
If I could just move faster!
The Wraith falls to the ground.
We'll rest here a few minutes.
You should go on without me.
No! The 'Gate's guarded. We'll have a better chance of taking out the guards in a crossfire. I still need you.
That is, even if we're going in the right direction.... You have no idea where the Stargate is, do you?
The Wraith sits back down, defeated.
Way to go, John! Listen to a Wraith.
It was not my intention to deceive you, Sheppard.
The radio in Sheppard's hand squawks.
(over radio) Our reinforcements have arrived at the Stargate, Commander.
(over radio) Kill the Wraith on sight, but I want Sheppard alive.
Well, we learned two things. One, he likes me better than you.
Two, we probably would've never made it to the Stargate anyway.
No. Our people don't leave each other behind. That's three things you've learned.
Kolya doesn't know where we are. He's wasting manpower that could be used searching for us guarding the 'Gate. The odds of my people finding us are going up and up.
You are more like Wraith than you know.
I'm not sure I like the sound of that.
There is much about Wraith that you do not know, Sheppard.
The rest of Sheppard's team, Beckett, and Weir wait in her office.
We haven't heard anything from Ladon, either.
Is it possible they were in on this from the beginning?
No, I don't think so. Eh...why would Ladon come here in the first place?
What kind of a plan would that be?
Either way, there must be a reason why Kolya has not contacted us.
Perhaps he knew it would take Colonel Sheppard more time to recover.
None of us are saying what we're all thinking here.
The Wraith lies face up on the ground. Sheppard is crouched, listening to the radio.
(over radio) Tell Kolya there's nobody around the 'Gate.
Sounds like they're concentrating their search around the 'Gate. They must think we knew where we were going.
The Wraith laughs, then sighs as he looks at the three moons in the sky.
Oh, it was worth it...if only to see the sky again.
My wound is deep. If I do not feed soon...I will die.
He partially sits up and looks at Sheppard.
Buck up. We got a deal, remember. We both go home...alive.
And if we were to meet again in the future...what then?
(after a pause) All bets are off.
(chuckling) Then let us hope we do not meet again.
Try to get some sleep. I'll take the first watch.
The Wraith lies down again. With a groan, Sheppard gets to his feet.
The team, Beckett, and Weir enter the room. The Stargate is active.
I'm receiving the new Genii IDC along with a video feed.
Ladon's face appears on the monitor.
We were starting to get worried.

(over video) Yes, I'm sure you had doubts. But the truth is, the interrogation took longer than I hoped. We've secured the location of Kolya's base. I'm forwarding you the dialing coordinates right now.
(over video) Certain enough to send a full brigade through the Gate. It will take us an hour to marshall our forces. I thought you might want that time.
What will we be up against?
(over video) Nothing one of your cloaked jumpers and my good friend Ronon couldn't handle. I ask only that you leave Kolya for my own forces to find.
(to team) All right, get a cloaked jumper and a team of marines.
McKay takes off. Beckett raises his hand.
I'd like to reserve one of those seats for a member of my medical team.
Done. (looking at Ronon) And if you do find Kolya...?

Sheppard and the Wraith both sleep. Genii soldiers approach their position. The Wraith awakens, hearing the guards. He gets up, clutching his side, and goes over to Sheppard, Sheppard awakens, but is groggy.

The Wraith feeds on Sheppard. Sheppard becomes almost skeletal, and very aged. The guards arrive, finding Sheppard's fed upon body, but bypassing it. The Wraith jumps down from the tree above. He is strong, knocking guards away and taking fire at point blank range. He knocks down the remaining two shooters, then feeds on one while holding down the other.
The Stargate activates. Several Genii soldiers watch as a puddle jumper comes through and instantly cloaks as they fire on it.
McKay flies the jumper, Teyla in the copilot seat. Beckett, Ronon, and marines are also in the jumper. The HUD display is in front of them.
Dots appear on the screen. Some disappearing as they talk.
We're detecting life signs on the surface, miles from the bunker.
When it first came up, it was eight, then four...I don't get it. Now, it's just the two.
Well, one of them's definitely Sheppard. His subcutaneous transmitter's still broadcasting.
Could the other one be Kolya?
Let's hope so. (to McKay) Land a hundred meters to the south of their position.
The soldiers are all dead. The Wraith stands over Sheppard. He is barely alive. The Wraith bends down.
As I told you, John Sheppard, there are many things about Wraith that you do not know.
He reaches out with his feeding hand.

In another area of the forest, Sheppard's team and the marines approach. Ronon leads, signaling to hold. They hear Sheppard cry out in agony. Everyone races forward. Ronon pulls the Wraith off of Sheppard and raises his gun.
The Wraith stands. Sheppard gets up. He looks fine, as he did before the first feeding. Everyone surrounds the Wraith, weapons raised.
Ronon grudgingly complies and lowers his weapon.
I don't understand. We all saw what he did to you.
They stare at Sheppard in shock. Sheppard also looks confused as he approaches the Wraith.
He just undid it. Lower your weapons.
The gift of life is reserved only for our most devout worshipers...and our brothers.
Well, I guess there's a lot about the Wraith we don't know.
Sheppard gave me back my life. I merely repaid the debt.
(incredulous) What debt?! Are you kidding? I mean, he looks younger than he did before!
Sheppard feels his pockets for the radio. He finds it on the ground where he'd been lying.
Kolya stands beside an active wormhole. He picks up his radio.
(over radio) This is Sheppard. Kolya? I figured you'd run! Next time, I kill you on sight, do you hear me?!
Kolya looks dismayed, and doesn't respond. He walks through the event horizon.
I did not truly expect you to honor it.
He chuckles. Ronon hands Sheppard his stunner. Sheppard looks at the gun, grabs it and shoots the Wraith. Ronon snatches the gun back and checks the setting.
No, I didn't. (to marines) Get him in the jumper. We're gonna drop him off somewhere.
The marines start dragging the unconscious Wraith. Sheppard follows.
(to McKay as he passes) Thanks for showing up.
The Wraith awakens with a start. He sees Sheppard, geared up and holding a P-90 aimed toward him. The Stargate is active in the distance. The Wraith feels his chest for injury.
There's a lot you don't know about humans.
The Wraith looks around, realizing he is on a different planet.
(nodding) Ah, I see. Next time we meet?

They stare at each other. A Wraith dart is heard flying overhead. While the Wraith looks at it, Sheppard backs into the cargo hold of the cloaked jumper, disappearing when the Wraith looks around. He feels a breeze.
